titlestmt.titleproper: American Society of International Law records, Howard M. Holtzmann papers
A Guide to the American Society of International Law records, Howard M. Holtzmann papers FA1872

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2024-10-01 04:59:02 UTC.
profiledesc.langusage: Description is written in: English, Latin script.

did.unittitle: American Society of International Law records, Howard M. Holtzmann papers

physdesc.extent: 162 legal document boxes and 2 oversize flat boxes.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Open for research. Brittle or damaged items are available at the discretion of RAC.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Series I: Correspondence, 1923-2011. Series II: Writings. Series III: Iran-United States Claims Tribunal, 1981-2009. Series IV: United Nations Commission on International Trade Law, 1974-2011. Series V: American Arbitration Association, 1968-2012. Series VI: Arbitration, 1973-2013. Series VII: Organizations, 1957-2010. Series VIII: Claims Resolution Tribunal, 1997-2002. Series IX: Business, 1973-2013. Series X: Personal, 1941-2012.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: American Society of International Law has title, copyright, and literary rights in the collection, in so far as it holds them. Rockefeller Archive Center has authority to grant permission to cite and publish archival material from the collection.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Howard M. Holtzmann papers document the life and work of Judge Howard M. Holtzmann, and help to tell the story of international commercial arbitration and conciliation through the lens of one of its foremost experts and practitioners.

Judge Holtzmann helped to develop and codify many of the precepts and protocols of international arbitration and mass claims processes through his landmark work as an arbitrator with international organizations such as the Iran-United States Claims Tribunal, the United Nations Commission on International Trade Law, the Claims Resolution Tribunal for Dormant Accounts in Switzerland, and the American Arbitration Association, as well as in private practice with the firm Holtzmann, Sheppard, and Wise.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains the correspondence and memos written and received by Judge Holtzmann, in both a professional and personal capacity. Included herein are groupings of correspondence organized by Holtzmann. The bulk of the correspondence ranges from the 1970s through the first decade of the 2000s.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains correspondence created and arranged by Holtzmann for his personal records.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Original order as created by Holtzmann. Files are primarily grouped together as Chronological Files, and in other select thematic groupings.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This subseries consists of the general correspondence and memos of Holtzmann.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Arranged as received, primarily by broad thematic groupings.

did.unittitle: American Bar Association Program on Arbitration

physdesc.extent: 29 legal document boxes and 2 oversize flat boxes

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains the manuscripts and typescript drafts, notes, correspondence, and research and reference material pertaining to some of Judge Holtzmann's published and unpublished writings.

did.unittitle: The Papers of Howard M. Holtzmann

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Original order by Holtzmann, as received, transcribed by his assistants.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains Volumes I-VI of Holtzmann's selected papers, as well as speech materials, personal papers, and general papers. Contained are both the transcriptions and the original manuscripts and typescripts.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This subseries is largely comprised of essays, speeches, lectures, notes, interviews, and other public presentations. It also contains drafts, research materials, correspondence, and notes pertaining to several of Holtzmann's books, the "Code of Ethics for Arbitrators", "A Guide to the UNCITRAL Model Law on International Commercial Arbitration: Legislative History and Commentary". and "International Mass Claims Processes: Legal and Practical Perspectives", which he edited with Edda Kristjansdottir. Also of interest in this subseries are several light verses, satirical sketches, and fictional pieces written by Holtzmann, including "A Caribbean Christmas Carol", "Izzard Goes to Italy", and "The Wound and the Bow".

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains the manuscripts and typescripts of writings, primarily articles and book chapters, written by people other than Holtzmann.

did.unittitle: Higgins, Francis J., William G. Brown, and Patrick J. Roach

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The material in this series documents Judge Holtzmann's extensive work as the senior US member of the Iran-US Claims Tribunal from its convening in 1981 through 1994. Included are correspondence, chronological files, official documents, memos, communiques, personal notes, and drafts of rulings and resoultions from the Tribunal. Also contained here is a substantial Index to Issues that outlines the various claims and rules covered by the Tribunal.

physdesc.extent: 37 legal document boxes and 1 oversize flat box

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series includes material pertaining to Holtzmann's time as a US delegate to UNCITRAL, and includes correspondence, working group papers, conference and seminar materials, research materials, writings, and numerous draft documents of arbitration rules. The latter material includes final versions of arbitration rules and model laws, as well as early versions, correspondence relating to their drafting, and corrected drafts and commentary on the rules.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Primarily arranged by record type and alphabetically. Session and working group materials are arranged by session number and date. Arbitration rule drafts are arranged by rule number.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: The American Arbitration Association (AAA) is a non-profit organization in the field of alternative dispute resolution, providing services to individuals and organizations who wish to resolve conflicts out of court.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains material created by Holtzmann as part of the governance of the AAA, as well as arbitration proceedings under its auspices. Materials include executive committee meeting minutes and notes, model clauses and decisions for various cases, conference information and publications, research materials, and correspondence.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Alphabetical by function and record type.

physdesc.extent: 15 legal document boxes and 1 oversize flat box

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Judge Holtzmann also practice widely in the field of arbitration. This series consists of material relating to many of these cases and clients. Materials include written discussions of the cases, drafts and final versions of arbitration rulings, correspondence regarding these cases, and research material.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Reflecting the scope of Judge Holtzmann's engagment with the international legal community, this series contains materials pertaining to his work with a wide variety of non-governmental, international governmental, and educational institutions and organizations. Organizations include: the American Bar Association, the Environmental Law Institute, the International Chamber of Commerce, the International Council for Commercial Arbitration, and the Permanent Court of Arbitration. Materials include correspondence, memos and communiques, conference material, meeting minutes, drafts of rules and policy, writings, and research and printed materials.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: From 1997-2001, Judge Holtzmann worked as an arbitrator on the Claims Resolution Tribunal I and II. This series contains material produced as a consequence of that work, including correspondence, reference and research material, writings and drafts of rules and resolutions, and organizational and administrative records.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series is comprised of the business chronological files of Judge Holtzmann.
The records provide information unique to this series, as well as cross-reference material on similar subjects found elswhere in the collection.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Arranged alphabetically, in original order, as received. Primarily arranged by organization, institution, particular project, broad themes and subjects, and persons of interest to the various legal and arbitration work of Holtzmann.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains items related to Judge Holtzmann in a personal capacity, including financial documents, notes, and materials relating to his family. Many documents, including correspondence and financial material, pertaining to Holtzmann's longstanding involvement in the governance, academics, and endowment of Yale and the Yale Law School are contained here. Additionally, this series contains correspondence and records related to Holtzmann's work at the law firm of Holtzmann, Wise, and Sheppard. This series also contains the printed and published material used and retained by Holtzmann for reference and research. Materials include journals, pamphlets, books and periodicals.
